meanings.definition: a brief summary or general survey of something
meanings.sent1: I always read the synopses of movies before deciding to watch them.
meanings.sent2: The synopses at the back of the book helped me understand the plot better.
meanings.sent3: The synopses of the TV show were so funny, I couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a series of synopses, capturing the essence of each conversation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's synopses of the lesson made it easy to remember the key points.

meanings.definition: a condensed version of a written work or story
meanings.sent1: The synopses of the novel were helpful for my book report.
meanings.sent2: I prefer reading synopses of long stories to save time.
meanings.sent3: The synopses of the play were like mini-movies in my mind.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a series of synopses, cutting through the details to the core message.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was a visual synopses of the entire exhibition.
